Authors:
seyed akbar khodaparast, Amir Hossein Mohammadi, Mina
Hghdel, Hossein Masigol
Title:
Taxonomic and phylogenetic position of Phyllactinia
takamatsui, a new undescribed powdery mildew on cotoneaster, based on
molecular and morphological data
Abstract:
The new powdery mildew species Phyllactinia takamatsui on
Cotoneaster nummularius (Rosaceae) is described and illustrated. This
species, collected in Kerman province, Iran, is well characterized by
its conidial morphology and rDNA ITS sequences clearly different from
allied species. Conidia are broadly ellipsoid to subcylindrical,
i.e. and they are not clavate-spathuliform as in most Phylactinia
species. The rDNA ITS sequence analysis showed that this species is
closest to other species described on hosts belonging to Rosaceae such
as Ph. mail and Ph. pyri-serotinae, but the overall genetic similarity
of data based on this marker ranged between 92 and 94% in BLASTN search,
i.e. below percentages suggesting that different species are involved.
The new species is described in detail, illustrated and compared with
genetically and allied and morphologically similar taxa.
